intro: Thelysia palaestina, commonly known as the Palestine thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions. Its leaves are spiny and grayish-green, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a rounded head. Thelysia palaestina is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
